Collection.descr:
Introduction

 

Parts of Speech বুঝতে পারার মানে হল Word এর Nature বা প্রকৃতি সম্বন্ধে ধারণা লাভ করা।

Parts of Speech এর গুরুত্ব Grammar এ অপরিসীম। Parts of Speech বুঝলেই ইংরেজী Grammar এর অর্ধেক বোঝা সম্পন্ন বলে আমরা মনে করি।

Sentence এ ব্যবহৃত Word বা শব্দ হল Parts of Speech।

In English, In a sentence words are divided into different classes or kinds because of their functions and usage. And it is described by the term of parts of speech.

সকল Parts of Speech-ই words, কিন্তু সকল Words Parts of Speech নয়। Word যতক্ষনে বাক্যে ব্যবহৃত না হয় অর্থাৎ Sentence-এর অংশ না হয়, ততক্ষনে কোন Word-কে Parts of Speech বলা যায় না।

 

Sentence এ ব্যবহৃত Word এর ভূমিকা বা Functioning অনুযায়ী সমস্ত Words কে ৮ শ্রেনীতেভাগ করা যায়। অর্থাৎ, Words সমূহ বাক্যে ৮ রকমের ভূমিকা পালন করতে পারে। সুতরাং,

Part of Speech ৮ প্রকার:

Noun (বিশেষ্য)
Pronoun (সর্বনাম)
Adjective (নাম বিশেষণ)
Verb (ক্রিয়া)
Adverb (ক্রিয়া বিশেষণ/ বিশেষণীয় বিশেষণ)
Preposition (পদান্বয়ী অব্যয়)
Conjunction (সংযোজক অব্যয়)
Interjection (আবেগ সূচক অব্যয়)

Noun, Pronoun, Adjective, Verb ও Adverb এ ৫টি সব্যয় এবং Preposition, Conjunction ও Interjection-এ ৩টি অব্যয়।

বিশেষ লক্ষ্যনীয়

একটি Word কোন্‌ Part of Speech হবে তা নির্ভর করে বাক্যে ঐ word-টি কি ভূমিকা পালন করে, তার উপর। বাক্যে ব্যবহৃত না হওয়া পর্যন্ত উহা কোন ভূমিকা পালন করে না এবং কোন Part of Speech-ও হয় না। কেবল মাত্র বাক্যে ব্যবহৃত word-ই Part of Speech।

‘Water’ কোন্‌ Part of Speech?—কোন Part of Speech নয়। একটি word মাত্র।

কিন্ত, I drink water. এই বাক্যে ‘water’ একটি Part of Speech এবং Noun.

I water the plant. এখানে ‘water’ একটি Part of Speech এবং Verb.

I need a water pot. এখানেও ‘water’ একটি Part of Speech, তবে Adjective.

Noun (বিশেষ্য)

 

বাক্যে যে word নাম indicate করে অর্থাৎ Subject বা Object রূপে ব্যবহৃত, তাকেই Noun বলে।

সহজভাবে বলা যায়, যে word দ্বারা কোনব্যক্তি, স্থান বা বস্তুর নাম বোঝায়, তাকে Noun বলে।

Examples

Sumon is a brilliant student. (ব্যক্তির নাম)
Dhaka is the capital of Bangladesh. (স্থানের নাম)
He gave me a red pen.(বস্তুর নাম)

একটি বাক্যে বহুসংখ্যক Noun ব্যবহৃত হতে পারে। বাক্যে Verb-এর Subject এবং Object রূপে ব্যবহৃত শব্দগুলো অবশ্যই Noun অথবা equivalent to Noun (Noun-এর সমতুল্য) হতে হবে। Preposition-এর Object রূপে ব্যবহৃত word গুলোও অবশ্যই Noun বা equivalent to Noun হবে।

Noun can be classified into five categories:

Proper Noun (Dhaka, Bangladesh, Sumon)
CommonNoun (boy, girl, book, table, bird, city)
Collective Noun (class, army, mob, gang, team, jury)
Abstract Noun (honesty, beauty, movement, laughter, death, poverty)
Material Noun (iron, steel, copper, gold, coal, silver, water)

Pronoun (সর্বনাম)

 

যে সকল word Noun- এর পরিবর্তে ব্যবহৃত হয় অর্থাৎ Noun-এর substitute রূপে ব্যবহৃত হয়, তাদেরকে Pronoun বলে।

In English, a Pronoun is a word used instead of a noun-equivalent. It is the replacement of noun.

বাক্যে Noun যে ভূমিকা পালন করে, Pronoun-ও Noun-এর পরিবর্তে ব্যবহৃত হয়ে ঠিক সে ভূমিকাই পালন করে। অর্থাৎ Pronoun-ও কোন Verb-এর Subject এবং Object হতে পারে।

Examples

Hasan is a good boy. He goes to school everyday.
His contribution is appreciable.
She is a intelligent girl.

সুতরাং Noun ও Pronoun ভিন্ন শ্রেনীর হলেও ভূমিকা পালনের প্রেক্ষিতে উহারা একই group-এর বলে বিবেচিত। Noun ও Pronoun একে অন্যের equivalent।

 

There are many different kinds of pronoun. Such as:

Personal Pronoun (I, we, he, she, me, you, her him)
Possessive Pronoun (his, hers, yours, its)
Reflexive Pronoun (myself, himself, herself, ourselves, themselves, yourselves, itself.
Indefinite Pronoun (any, anything, some, someone, somebody, everybody, everything,)
Demonstrative Pronoun (This, these, that, those)
Relative Pronoun (that, who, whom, where, when, whoever, whichever, whomever)
Interrogative Pronoun (who, which, what, whom, whose)
Reciprocal Pronoun (Each other, one other)

Adjective (বিশেষণ)

 

যে word শুধুমাত্র Noun বা Pronoun-কে qualify করে অর্থাৎ শুধুমাত্র নামপদের বিশেষত্ব বা বৈশিষ্ট্য প্রকাশ করে, তাকে Adjective বলে।

সহজভাবে বলা যায়, যে Word কোন Noun বা Pronoun- এর দোষ, গুণ, অবস্থা, সংখ্যা, পরিমাণইত্যাদি বোঝায়, তাকে Adjective বলে।

In English, an Adjective is a word used for qualifying (or adding something to) the meaning of a Noun or Pronoun.

He gave me a red pen. — এ বাক্যে ‘pen’ Noun এবং ‘red’ Adjective.

Examples

Jahid is a bad boy. (দোষ)
Runa is a good girl. (গুণ)
He is ill. (অবস্থা)
I have five pens. (সংখ্যা)
He has much money. (পরিমাণ)

There are many different kinds of Adjective. Such as:

Qualitative Adjective or Descriptive Adjective or Adjective of quality (great, good, bad, wise, poor, nice, happy, pretty, angry, blue)
Quantitative Adjective or Adjective of quantity (some, little, much, enough, whole, sufficient, all, none, more, half)
Numeric Adjective or Adjective of Number (one, two, three, ………., first, second, third, ……………, single, double, triple, quadruple, twofold, threefold, fivefold)
Demonstrative Adjective (this, that, those, these)
Distributive Adjective ( every, each, neither, either, both)
Possessive Adjective (his, her, him, my, our, your, their)
Interrogative Adjective (which, what, whose)

Verb (ক্রিয়া)

 

যে word দ্বারা কোন কাজ করা বা সম্পন্ন হওয়া বুঝায় তাকে Verb বলে। কাজ করা না বুঝালে উহা Verb নয়।

সহজভাবে বলা যায়, যে Word দ্বারা কোন কাজ করা বোঝায়, তাকে Verb বলে।

In English, a Verb is a word used for saying something about a person or a thing.

প্রত্যেক Sentence এ এক বা একাধিক Verb থাকে। Verb ছাড়া Sentence হয় না।

Examples

We play cricket.
He writes a letter.
She gives me pen.
He has a Laptop.
He is a good boy.
Kinds of Verb

Firstly verb is divided into two categories:

Main or Principal Verb
Auxiliary or Helping Verb
Principal or Lexical Verb

Verbs which are used independently without help of other verbs are called Principal or Main verb.

Examples

He is a singer.
She does her job.
They have many problems.

Principal verbs are two types depending on the object they take:

 a. Transitive verb

Transitive verb is an action verb that requires one or more objects which receive the action of the verb in a sentence.

Examples

She reads the book. (verb with the object ‘the book’)
He gave me a mobile phone. (verb with the object ‘me’ and ‘mobile phone’)

b. Intransitive verb

Intransitive verb is an action verb that requires no direct object in the sentence.

Examples

She reads. (no object in the sentence)
Sit down here.
The birds are flying.

Auxiliary or Helping Verb:

Verbs which help a Principal verb to form a sentence are called Auxiliary or Helping verb.

Examples

He is singing a song.
They are doing her job.
Auxiliary verbs are two types:

a. Primary or Tense Auxiliaries such as be, am, is was, are, were, been, being, have, has, had, having, do, does and did.

Examples

I am doing the job. (present Continuous)
Ryan was sleeping that moment. (past Continuous)
It is done by her. (passive form)

b. Modal Auxiliaries such as can, could, shall, should, will, would, may, might, must, need, dare, used to, ought to etc.

Modals only take the base form of verbs after them.

Examples

Shall we start the game? (Asking the question)
You should read the book attentively. (Suggest)
Would you give a cup of coffee? (request)
I can do the sum? (ability)

Finite and Non-finite Verbs

Finite verb:

A Verb which changes its form according to the number, person or tense and must has subject is called finite verb

Example:

I saw her crying.
He makes me proud.

Non-finite verb:

A Non-finite verb is a form of verb that is not limited by person, number or tense in a sentence and cannot act as main verb.

There are three kinds of non-finite verbs.

i. Infinite
ii. Gerund
iii. Participles

Adverb (ক্রিয়া বিশেষণ/ বিশেষণীয় বিশেষণ)

 

যে word Verb, Adjective এবং অন্য কোন Adverb-কে modify করে, তাকে Adverb বলে।

অন্যভাবে বলা যায়, “An Adverb qualifies anything except a Noun or a Pronoun.”

মনে রাখতে হবেঃ Adjective কেবলমাত্র Noun এবং Pronoun কে qualify করে। পক্ষান্তরে, Adverb modify করে Adjective, Verb ও Adverb কে। অর্থাৎ একটি Adverb অন্য Adverb-কে modify করে।

 

Karim is a very good boy– বাক্যে boy(N)-কে qualify করেছে good। কেমন boy?—good boy। সুতরাং good Adjective। আবার, কেমন good? – very good। ‘very’ শব্দটি good (adj.)-কে modify করেছে। সুতরাং ‘very’ Adverb।

Examples

The leopard runs quickly.
He works extremely hard.
She is a very beautiful girl.
There are different kinds of adverb according to their functions in a sentence.

i. Adverbs of Time: Indicate the time of an action and answer the question ‘when’?
Such as now, soon, still, then, today, yet, since, back, ago, already, before, after, recently, today, lately, tomorrow, once, someday, early etc.

ii. Adverbs of Manner: Express the manner of an action and answer the question ‘How’?
Such as happily, slowly, quickly, carefully, loudly, easily, fast, bravely, hard, well, badly etc.

iii. Adverbs of Place: Indicate the place of an action and answer the question ‘Where’?
Such as here, there, up, down, in, out, by, hither, thither, where, anywhere, somewhere, everywhere, nowhere etc.

iv. Adverbs of Degree or Quantity: Express quantity and answer the question ‘How much/ How far/ to what extent’?
Such as extremely, fully, quite, almost, very much, too, a lot, totally, absolutely, fairly, hardly, rather etc.

v. Adverbs of Affirmation and negation: Indicate assertion and express the one’s reaction to question.
Such as yes, no, yeah

vi. Adverbs of Frequency: Express the frequency of an action and answer the question “How often”?
Such as never, ever, always, often, seldom, everyday, sometimes, usually, normally, frequently, rarely, hardly, scarcely, once a week etc.

vii. Adverbs of reason: Express the reason and make the conclusion.
Such as hence, therefore, thence etc.

Preposition (পদান্বয়ী অব্যয়)

 

যে word Noun বা Pronoun-এর পূর্বে বসে’ বাক্যের অন্য অংশের সাথে ঐ Noun বা Pronoun-কে সম্পর্কিত বা অন্বিত করে, তাকে Preposition বলে।

In English, A Pronoun is a word that is placed before a noun or a pronoun to show the relation of that noun or pronoun with any other word of the sentence.

Verb- এর Subject এবং Object ছাড়া বাক্যে ব্যবহৃত অন্য যেকোন Noun বা Pronoun-এর পূর্বে অবশ্যই Preposition বসাতে হবে। মূলতঃ Preposition বাক্যে Noun বা Pronoun-এর Connector রূপে কাজ করে। Noun বা Pronoun ছাড়া অন্য কোন Parts of Speech-এর পূর্বে কখনো কোন Preposition বসবে না। 

বিপরীতক্রমে, Preposition এর পরে অবশ্যই Noun বা Pronoun বা Noun-এর সমতূল্য কোন শব্দ বস শব্দ সমষ্টি অবশ্যই থাকতে হবে। Noun বা Pronoun না থাকলে Preposition নিষ্প্রয়োজন।

I go to school. বাক্যে  ‘to’ একটি  Preposition। কারন উহা ‘school’ টিকে connect করেছে।

Examples

  1. He is looking for papers.
  2. Rifat lives in Dhaka.
  3. The book is on the table. 
  4. The man is under the tree.

Prepositions are five different kinds:

  1. Simple Preposition (in, at, by, of, for, on, over, under, up, to, from, out, about, under, with)
  2. Double Preposition ( into, onto, within, without, from, among, toward, behind etc)
  3. Compound or Phrasal or Complex Prepositions (instead of, in front of, in between, out of, in behalf of, in place of, except for, throughout, underneath, according to)
  4. Participial Preposition (concerning, regarding, considering, pending)

 

Following are the specific area to use prepositions.

i. Preposition of Place, Position and Direction (in, at, on, by, next, to, beside,)

In
At
On
By
Above
To
Towards
From
Into		 In the room.
At the window. At the office.
On the table.
Sitting by the woman.
Above the sky.
Go to university.
Towards east.
Fled from home.
Jumped into the well.

 

ii. Preposition of time

At
After
Before
By
During
From
For
In
On
Since
Within
throughout		 At 10 a.m., at dawn, at noon, at night, at an early age.
After 3 O’clock, after his arrival.
Before the 15th July.
By 4 p.m.
During five years. During the whole day/summer, during five years.
From 1st January.
For a week/month. 
In June, in 2010, in the morning/evening/afternoon.
On Sunday. 
Since he comes.
Within three days.
Throughout the year.

 

iii. Preposition of Reason or Purpose

For
Form
Of
Through
With		 For the good of the people, died for the country.
Died from fatigue, suffering from fever/cold.
Died of cancer.
Lost his pen through negligence
Trembles with fear shivers with fever.

Conjunction (সংযোজক অব্যয়)

 

যে word একাধিক word, Phrase বা clause-কে যুক্ত করে, তাকে Conjunction বলে।

In English, A Conjunction is a word for joining one word to another word, or one sentence to another sentence.

যেমন: Rahim and Karim went there. বাক্যে ‘and’ শব্দটি Rahim ও Karim Noun দুটিকে যুক্ত করেছে। সুতরাং ‘and’ এখানে conjunction।

A conjunction is a part of speech or word that connects –

- One word to another word.
- One word to another clause.
- One sentence to another sentence.

Examples

Rupom is a boy but Runa is a girl.
Do the work or leave this place.
I trust him because he is honest.
He says that he will do it.
He is so weak that he cannot walk.
He is both a fool and a knave.

There are different types of conjunctions:

Coordinate Conjunction
Subordinate Conjunction
Correlative conjunction

1. Coordinate Conjunction:

Coordinate conjunctions such as and, but, or, nor, for, so, or yet are used to join individual words, phrases and independent clauses.

Examples

She stood first and got a prize.
He is sad but hopeful.
The snake is small but dangerous.

2. Subordinate Conjunction:

The subordinate clause such as since, because, although, as, until etc. are used to join an independent clause to a dependent clause. The subordinate conjunctions are used before the dependent clauses. Dependent clause can be placed before or after the independent clauses.

Examples

He never gives up until he wins.
Since she had the headache, she did not go to work.
Though he loved her cousin, he married another one.
Despite calling several times, she never received a replay.

3. Correlative conjunctions:

Correlative conjunctions are pairs of conjunctions such as both…and, either…..or, neither……nor etc. used in the sentences to link words, phrases and clauses. Correlative conjunctions connect two words or phrases or clauses those have the similar structure and are grammatically similar. That means nouns are linked to nouns, adjectives to adjectives, prepositional phrases to prepositional phrases.

Examples

He is both a fool and a knave. (noun to noun)
He must either work or go. (verb to verb)
Hardly had I left the room when it began to rain.

Interjection (আবেগ সূচক অব্যয়)

 

যে word মনের আবেগ প্রকাশ করে, তাকে Interjection বলে।

In English, The part of speech that expresses strong feeling or sudden emotions or sentiment is called interjection or exclamation.

Interjection একটি ভিন্নধর্মী Part of Speech। অন্যান্য Parts of Speech-এর মত বাক্যের অন্যান্য word বা অংশের সাথে Interjection-এর প্রত্যক্ষ সম্পৃক্ততা নেই।

Examples

Hurrah ! Today is holiday. (কী মজা- Interjection)
Alas ! He is dead. (হায়- Interjection)
Oh ! What a nice view. (আহা- Interjection)
Bravo ! You have done well. (সাবাস- Interjection)
